reviewText:
Super Crate Box is a 2D run and gun arcade platformer. If that is tough to digest, the game is played in a single screen. The point is to get crates. Once you get a crate, a new one spawns. Inside each crate is a random weapon that you've unlocked. Why do you get crates? To unlock new weapons, characters and levels to play on. There are only three levels, but I'm happy with that. The first level feels so good to play on that you almost don't need the other two.

Enemies drop from a hole in the ceiling of the level. Standard left and right moving enemies, when they get to the edge they fall off to the next one. There are bigger versions of the standard enemies that take twice as much damage. Finally, there are hovering skull enemies that bounce around. Its a nice simple variety that still adds challenge. Since the enemies work their way to the bottom, there is a fire pit. If the enemies reach the fire pits, they come back red, angry and twice the speed! In a way it feels like the original Mario Bros. arcade game. One screen levels, and enemies that get angry, doubling their speed.

The major difference is the guns. Each gun has unlimited ammo and feels fun to use, with their own pro and con. Dual pistols will shoot left and right simultaneously, but do 1 bit of damage. The revolver shoots one bullet at a time, but does double damage. The machine gun shoots straight forward very quickly, but pushes you back. The flamethrower will effectively light platforms and enemies on fire, but if you stand in the fire, you can't jump. The katana has short range, but does a lot of damage and sends big enemies the other way. The shotgun has short range, but sends out a big blast of randomized bullets. The bazooka fires rockets that are slow to reload, but they do a lot of damage in a radius. Grenade launchers do the same thing, but they reload faster and arc when you shoot them. Mines take a while to arm themselves and can only drop straight down, but do the same big radius damage as rockets and grenades. Lasers take a long time to fire once you pull the trigger, but go through everything. The disc gun bounces off the first wall it hits and goes through enemies, but it will also kill you.

You can only carry one weapon, so when you get a crate, its a different weapon. Some weapons are better than others, so there is a dynamic of not getting a crate to use a good weapon to kill a screen full of enemies vs just getting the next crate.

You will unlock new characters, but they all play the same. They just different. The game will give you a random character when you play. One hit will kill you, but that's the balance. Guns vs swarms of enemies. With every death, the game will tell you what you've unlocked, how many more crates you need and send you right back in as if nothing happened. The whole thing takes a second or less. If the game gets too easy for you on normal mode, there is a hard mode.

The game keeps track of your high score in crates, but there are no points awarded. Hopefully there will be a more complete sequel with support for co-op and points, but that is in no way a complaint for this great FREE arcade game. In all, its a fun free game. If it came out in the 80s, Super Crate Box would have made millions of dollars in quarters. Not just that, but this free little game is enough to make me want to play other games from the developer.

reviewText:
Super Crate Box is a small, indie game that consists of the player battling against green and white monsters with a variety of firearms. You play a character and your objective is to collect as many crates (which contain different kinds of weapons, which one uses to defeat the monsters.) before dieing. This game can be frustrating though, considering the fact that your character dies in one touch of any of the monsters, one has to be carefull in jumping around a small map and firing guns at monsters, who can sometimes be in groups of many and can be difficult to take out.

In each crate, there is a weapon. The player has to use the weapon until they obtain another crate and get a different gun or dies. This is a cycle of repetition, since the game can go for infinite amount of time, with one's score going higher by one with every crate obtained. With the higher number of crates obtained in one life, the more guns and different kinds of characters one can get. There are three ways to die in this game. First is touching a monster and dieing quickly. Second is falling into a fire, which is at the very bottom-middle of the map you are placed in. Monsters follow a continous pathway down into the fire, but appear at the top, faster and turned red/purple. Third is by one of the guns one can use. It fires a bullet that goes completely horizontal back and forth twice. If one character gets hit by the bullet, it gets sliced in half, killing it.

Although this game is rather violent, there is no gore whatsoever in this game. There is no blood or organs coming out of the  body of the character or the monsters. If either one die, they just fall of the screen with no blood spilling everywhere, so I'd say it's an E10+ game (if it's rated).

I recommend this game to people who love Indie games and who also love a good repetitive game of endless enjoyment in blowing up or knocking off monster with a whole loadout of many weapons at random. The only downside to this game is that it can get a little frustrating with dieing so quickly when one is so close to unlocking a different character, but is nonetheless a fun game to play.

It's a fast, addictive, and brutally challenging in all the right ways slice of arcade platforming, and will only take a minute of your time to play. Provided of course you can manage to pull yourself away.

This is a game you will try for 15 minutes and then immediately put away, never to look at again. Yes, it's free. Yes, it's only 23 MB. But this game is boring, repetitive, tedious, un-customizable, frustrating, unintelligent, and unrewarding.

In Super Crate Box, you're a short, pixely character who seems to move way too loosely given his size. You start off with a basic gun and you have to shoot enemies who drop down from the top and inevitably come at you from the left and right sides. If they make it to the bottom, they fall into a pit of fire and drop back down from the top of the screen in a frenzied state where they move much faster. It's easy to get swarmed and some enemies take more than one shot to kill. You're going to die quickly and frequently. Your objective is collect boxes (crates) that each contain a different weapon and which instantly replaces your previous one. You can't change back to the one you just had, and you MUST use the new one (sometimes down-grading you). You can unlock better weapons, but the one you get with each new box is random. Now, gameplay-wise the control is all right (I find the jumping to be somewhat awkward) but my main issue gameplay-wise is that you can't customize the controls. Come on, this is 2014, players deserve better (and before anyone rushes to assumptions, let me just say that some people are left-handed and prefer using WASD for movement over the arrow keys; thanks).

Let's be honest here, this is one of THOSE games, the kind whose sole purpose is to be more frustrating and challenging than interesting, involving, or innovative. I honestly don't know what others see in this game. It's more like a game you'd use to play a trick on your friends than one you'd actually take seriously. At its core, it's simply an arcade game where you see how long you can last. That's it. reviewText:
This game is insane, but really fun and addictive.

You essentially play as a 2D sprite (which changes every time you die) who shoots green monsters, big and small, and collects crates which change the characters weapon. The aim of the game is to collect as many crates as possible without dying, as 1 crate = 1 point.

You soon realise that some weapons are better than others, and therefore you have to collect crates quickly in order to replace the bad weapon with a better one. However, at the same time you are being bombarded by green creatures and floating white skulls whose touch equals instant death. This game involves multi-tasking, and improves hand-eye coordination at the same time.

I would recommend this to anybody who has a lot of spare time on their hands, or is just looking for a retro-style game which can be played over and over again. :)

reviewText:
Super Crate Box is a 2D platformer arcade game. Your objective is to collect as many crates as possible, while using any and every gun you have to kill the enemies falling from the ceiling. Everytime you grab a crate, you gain one more point and receive a new random weapon that you have unlocked. Each weapon is unique, fun and has its own reasons for use. Guns have unlimited ammo and deal different amounts of damage to the enemies. For example. Pistols take about 2 or 3 shots to kill the standard enemy of Super Crate Box, but an explosion from the rocket launcher is a one hit kill.

The way enemies move in this game is in a simple left and right motion. They continue to walk in the same direction until they come across a wall, then they will turn and move in the opposite direction as they make their way down the map towards a fire pit at the bottom. If an enemy makes its way to the pit of fire, they won't die, they will just fall throught the ceiling again. However, they will be angry allowing them to move twice as fast making for a adrenaline pumping challenge as you continue to collect crates and receive weapons.

There are three different enemies in this game. one you may already know is the small green guy, but there are larger green enemies that take two times the damage to kill. Finally there are floating skulls that fly around and also make their way down to the bottom of the map. The effects that fire has on enemies is the same for all three.

The game itself is addicting due to the fact that you must collect a number of crates to unlock new weapons, new characters, and new maps. You start with a fair weapon arsenal and will gain more guns as you play and develope your skills. Every game you start, you will have a random character picked for you, and every time you die you will have a new player modle. With this fact alone you will almost want to die just so you can see the new silly modles the game has in store for you. You start on a simple map with nothing much to see, but as you unlock more maps (three in total) you will find there to be more platforms to jump on and die on. The unlockible content is great, but if you find yourself playing with friends, you will be more worried about getting that amazing high score just to rub it in their face.

WARNING
Super Crate Box is almost like flappy bird. Fun, addicting, and will make even the most calm and collected people burst into anger.

Blip blip bang ZOMBIE SKULL AAAAH

In case it's not obvious, Irreverend Opinions is about to review Super Crate Box.

---

The Blurb
A free to play little mini arcade game which is surprisingly good.  You are fighting skulls.  Use weapons to kill them!  Collect weapons from crates.  Small platform levels.  Different weapons give you a different approach to combat; from bouncing buzz-saws to landmines and more.

The Good
An incredibly small game with a lot of bang for it's byte.  The gameplay is fast and fun, though very roguelike (like most arcade games).  It doesn't try to be anything else, and delivers on some simple, mindless fun.  Enemies have a bit of variety.

The Bad
RNG can kill you bad.  It's entirely possible to get a weapon that does nothing to help you.

The Ugly
Nothing really.

Suggestions
A bit more variety in level design, and improvements on the graphics (16 bit, even).  That said, it's a tiny, simple, free game.  Seriously, like picking at the bread on a free lunch.

The Summary
8/10.  The developers set out to make a simple 2D platform shooter and nailed it.

reviewText:
I've not played a defense game like this before.

While the critters themselves are cute, the game mechanic that makes this shine is the fact that no matter how cool the weapon you have is, you can't hold on to it. Your whole goal is to get the next crate (Which has a different weapon inside of it) and not die while doing so.

Each weapon has unique attributes, like exploding, or leaving a wake of flames, but some can even effect you! Weaponry like the 'Disc Gun' and 'Flamethrower' can actually end up getting you killed where normally you'd have been fine. Each weapon you have is usable in a different situation, and each situation can be taken differently. The weapons don't have an alternate fire-mode or anything like that, but each has an ability that none other does. (All of which are explained simply as you unlock them)

There are a number of maps, and when things get out of hand (IE, Lots of the critters start falling into Hell, and coming back angry at you) this game can be hysterically fun, and only gets better as you master the weapons and maps. Give it a go!

For free this game is hard not to recommend. Steam tags this game as free-to-play" but rest assured this game is purely free with no microtransactions involved.

The gist of the game is that you need to collect crates but each crate grants you a new weapon. Enemies will continue to spawn so while collecting these crates you will need to keep the enemy population in check. Not all weapons are created equal so the challenge becomes learning how to use each weapon and situations you should avoid getting yourself into with a particular weapon.

It appears this game was designed with keyboard in mind but it worked just fine with a USB controller.

This game comes up a little short in terms of content. Of course this is to be expected being a free game. If this game was a little more fleshed out I'd say this could go for $5.

7.5/10"

reviewText:
Super Crate Box: Game of the Year, sorry, CENTURY


Super Crate Box a long awaited open world  third-person shooter/platformer, met not only what we were hoping for but gave us more than anyone could ever imagine. Super Crate Box sends us to another dimension in a world of only a few pixels (however the game still looks awesome) where you can fight aliens of all different kinds; big green, small green, angry little red ones etc. aliens kill you in one touch, so you the survivor has to gather guns with unlimited ammo that are supplied in crates to kill off these wretched creatures. You start off with a dead on ordinary pistol to then find loads of other random weapons in the crates, these include but are not limited to: the minigun, dual pistols, machine gun, laser gun, etc. At the bottom of the platforms there is a hole with some fire in it -for no apparent reason, if the monsters fall into the fire it turns them angry and they travel much faster making it a harder time for you.

Not only has the creator's given us so much already, but they provide us as well with not 1, not 2 but 3 maps to play in, each one getting harder as you unlock them.


Super Crate Box also gives us a range of characters to play as and to unlock as you get a higher score. For each map you get normal level or SFMT level, normal is obviously average and SFMT is… absolute carnage.

And last but not least the leveling up is spectacular, you would think that how many aliens you kill provide you points however it is actually how many crates you collect, you can tell the developers were really thinking out of the box this time. Players of SCB have reached miraculous scores, you can see their scores at supercratebox.com.
Despite the lack of textures in some places of the map Super Crate Box has well earned its place in in the hall of AWESOME games. I have 32 hours on the game now and I am looking forward to spending many more.

reviewText:
I can honestly say, this is one of the best games I have in my Steam library. With a large range of weapons, characters, and maps, along with awesome retro graphics and music, this game is a great adition to anyone's collection of games.

PROS - Great music
- Pixel graphics that suit the game well
- Almost everything not default is unlockable
- Great weapons
- Awesome unlockable characters
- Unlockable maps
- Extra unlockable difficulties for each map
- The rest of the game is easier once you master the learning curve
- Lightning fast download speeds, boot up speeds, and FPS on my potato toaster
- Large amount of replayability
- It's free, so you won't lose anything if you don't like it

CONS - Has a large learning curve
- The other difficulties seem to have their own learning curve
- The game becomes a little bland once everything is unlocked
- THE DISC GUN A.K.A. SUICIDE GUN!

In Conclusion, 9/10 This game is an absolute gem, and is among some of the best games I've ever played. The only thing that stops this game from being perfect is the difficulty curve that almost put me off of this game the first time I played it. AND THE FRACKING DISC GUN! If you are a fan of 2D platformers and/or shooters, get this game. It's free, so the only thing you will lose is your time, especially if you like it.

reviewText: If there's anything I love about a game, it's simplicity. And that's exactly what Super Crate Box is, and arcade style shooter game where you need to get as many crates as possible, while dodging and killing enemies with the weapons you get from said crates. Now, it's important to note that as this review is being posted, (January 16th, 2015) there is a major bug in this game where it crashes after a couple minutes. I'm not gonna say don't get the game, cause it's free, so I can't argue. But, that does dissapoint me alot, as there's alot of things I wanted to talk about, but I'm constantly getting crashed on while playing. Now, if you're reading this months after this has been posted, and they fixed the bug. Then this game is absolutely fantastic, and I do recommend it totally. I've been on links that claim to fix the bug, but as I tried using it, Norton said it was a virus, so I don't think you should try using that option. I suggest just waiting for a fix to the problem, and enjoy those couple seconds of great fun while you can, cause it is a great game!
